intro: Herniaria euxina, commonly known as the European bladderwort, is a small, low-growing plant belonging to the family Caryophyllaceae. It is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves that are often lobed or notched, and it produces small, white or pink flowers. This species is typically found in coastal areas, sandy soils, and disturbed habitats, thriving in well-drained conditions. The plant is adapted to saline environments and can tolerate drought, which contributes to its distribution along the Mediterranean and Atlantic coasts. Its unique morphology and ecological adaptations make it an interesting subject for botanical study.
